Reviews.Title: Unreliable
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera less than a year ago, and despite the stabilization feature, about 90% of my photos turn out blurry and/or grainy. If lighting conditions are perfect I can get a clear photo; most of the time lighting conditions aren't perfect. I've talked to people about the blurry/grainy problem at a local camera shop and they believe that there is a defect in the internal stabilization. I contacted Olympus (which was a pain because even though their website said that they have online help, you really have to call a 1-800 number) and started the process to have it shipped to them (at my cost) to have them look at it and determine if there is anything wrong with it. At this point I feel as though it's better to write off the $150 I paid for it and just buy a better camera than dealing with Olympus' tedious procedures.I can't stress enough how unreliable this camera is for picture quality. If you're taking pictures of something important and prefer that they aren't blurry and grainy, I suggest a different camera.

Reviews.Title: Decent Little Camera
Reviews.Author: COMPUTER GEEK
Reviews.Content: The camera is very good looking, is slim and fits easily into any pocket. Picture quality wise, normal indoors and outdoor pictures are good to excellent quality. Flexible audio feedback for your actions (which is good for me because it was otherwise difficult to tell in outdoor conditions when the picture snapped). Reasonable delay between flash pics. The camera does a good job of selecting appropriate settings for most photo situations and you can override settings for extreme situations. I think it's a fine camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it
Reviews.Author: Sara
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera thinking it was cute and a good price for the 14mp.  When I got the camera, the screen had a black mark on it that covered up the picture when I tried to review it.  The black mark continued to expand essentially covering up the view of the pictures.  I sent it back to the store and got a replacement.  The replacement was worse.  IT didn't have a black mark in the beginning, but after about 4 days, half the screen was blocked out with black.  The guy a the store said the megapixels burst and it's normal.  I say it's not normal it's defective.  The camera also wouldn't turn off at one point or respond to any button commands and I had to take out the battery and put it back in to make it work.  I got my  money back.  Don't waste your time.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift and enjoyed it the first few uses. However the shutter is pretty loud for a small camera, sounds like it struggles to work. It also does not take quick photos, it was actually pretty frustrating during an "moving shots". Also while on vacation or display screen got a big black mark on it for an unknown reason (never dropped and always kept in a case). When we tried to contact the manufacturer they asked for 75.00 just to LOOK at it and warned that it likely would not be covered anyways. We are moving on to a completely different company. I would not recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Olynpus FE4020
Reviews.Author: BabsNFla
Reviews.Content: For the money, this camera works great.  If you are looking for a slim camera to slip in your pocket for quick shots, then this is it.  It has enough settings for the average user.

Reviews.Title: Pictures yes, video no
Reviews.Author: SFChuck
Reviews.Content: While the Olympus FE 4020 has some neat whiz-bang features, they apparently forgot about basic image quality...especially the video.  The still pictures are acceptably sharp but the color seems overly saturated.  The video function is where this camera really falls flat.  The zoom is jerky and the image at the long end is heavily pixellated...virtually unusable.  I had a 7 megapixel Samsung for several years (until the iris failed) and it could literally run rings around this Olympus in terms of video image quality...as could most video-capable cell phones.  I regret the purchase of the Olympus.

Reviews.Title: yeay
Reviews.Author: tea
Reviews.Content: Got the camera today. Love how the pictures turn out. They are great quality and there is so much you can do. I guess you just have to know what you are doing in order for it not to turn out grainy.Update: a year and a half after i bought it it died. do not waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Missing parts.
Reviews.Author: Murat Jenidi
Reviews.Content: The camera was received in a already opened box, not factory packaged.  It is missing the USB cable, and the AC charger / power cord.  The battery was already installed, therefore this item was previously used - NOT NEW!  If I do not receive the USB cable, and AC adapter / power cord by Friday I will be retturning the item for a full refund.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: I love the way it works and it takes great pictures. If you are in need of a gift for Christmas I recommend this camera for a loved one.

Reviews.Title: Great item for the great price.
Reviews.Author: Won Kim
Reviews.Content: For nearly the half of the retail price, this item is a no-nonsense 14MP digital camera for all-purpose photo taking needs. I love this item!

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: THECAMERAMASTER
Reviews.Content: i had a problem where i turn it off it shuts off immediately waste of money it now wont turn on at all battery charges but nothing works!

Reviews.Title: Good camera, not overly impressive
Reviews.Author: Melody McKibbin
Reviews.Content: Pros1. The compact size - it easily fits in a purse or pocket2. The price was good at the time I really needed a camera.The old adage of "you get what you pay for" is true. That being said, I wasn't expecting a professional quality camera, it isn't marketed as such, so please don't think it is.It is decent for what you pay for, it will take pictures in good lighting, low light- not so much.It has some auto scene settings which are kind of interesting.You can find a great DSLR camera for about $200 if you want one. (GE Brand). This Olympus is good for beginners or people who don't care about professional pictures. If you just want to have some family & pet photos for memories- then there is no need for a more expensive camera than this.14 MP sounds great, but in reality unless you are doing wall size, poster or professional prints- 8 is the most you should need - so if you do buy it, know that 14 MP will be HUGE and take up massive SD card space.Overall, this is a good camera and served me well when I used it, I just upgraded because I do a small hair accessories business which requires good pictures of my products and models, so am going to be purchasing a 16 MP DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Was a great first camera.
Reviews.Author: Jason Crawford "Jason C"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 6 months ago and adored it. It was my first camera, and I loved the simplicity of it. It came with great effects and settings. I started reading the manual and learning how to correctly work this camera. It recently was stolen, then smashed and threw into a creek. I found it in there about a week later. I dearly miss this camera, and feel uncomfortable buying another camera in fear it might not work as well as this one. In zoom, some of the pictures came out blurry, but this was somewhat resolved by using macro mode. I know this camera may have a few things others may not like but if you take good care of it and " get to know" the camera, I think it works great.

Reviews.Title: this will be our last Olympus
Reviews.Author: workaholic
Reviews.Content: Purchased as an upgrade to my Girlfriend's old Nikon Coolpix.  In bright sunlight, color rendition is terrible.  This camera is incredibly complicated, and just seems to take the joy out of taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: M. Vickers "Michaela"
Reviews.Content: I've had my Olympus fe 4020 now for two years.  Have taken a couple trips to Colorado and California since then, and I can tell you that my pics are GORGEOUS!  They are clear and sharp, and the colors are better than any other camera I've ever owned.There are some little bells and whistles in the menu option which I really like too.  There are settings for low light, bright light, closeups etc.  My advise is to use the proper setting for the proper picture results.  I've not had any problems whatsoever with getting beautiful picture results when used properly and with the correct settings.  Can you pay a gazillion dollars for a better camera?  Sure.  But why?  This is a great bang for your buck camera, and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the beginner
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Really not a bad camera. Sometimes I find the photos to be a little dark and grainy - so if you want great, crisp, bright photos all of the time you may want something different.For the price though - this camera is small, very easy to learn and if you have the right lighting and your subject is close than you can get good results. I am more of an outdoor photographer - so I don't really know how this camera is with portraits.So if you are new into photography - and want a small, inexpensive camera that you can learn quickly - and are willing to do a little editing at times to make your photos brigher - this is the camera for you!4/5 stars.

Reviews.Title: No really, DO NOT BUY IT in any color!!
Reviews.Author: H. Moyer "Tree Hippie"
Reviews.Content: I bought this exact camera a few years ago but rarely use it. Recently I took it w/ us on a road trip to Nebraska because I did not want to bring one of my more expensive cameras just in case of bad weather. My observation: Big black spot on screen (unknown how since I had it stored in a padded case), even after focusing the lens properly it still delays pics way too long and while shooting many "staged" pics from smoothly moving vehicle the blurry/grainy pics were rampant. I am an amatuer photographer and NEVER experienced such a crappy overall "camera". Then to top it off the lens just stop retracting and I now own a very expensive paperweight!! I have had it too long to get it fixed for free. Frankly, I will buy a different brand in the future. Sorry Olympus...you blew it big time with this one.

Reviews.Title: junk
Reviews.Author: mj
Reviews.Content: I bought the FE 4020 last Christmas and used it a couple of times and it has been unused in six mos.  Now it wont work.  The lens comes out but wont retract.  It wont take a photo.  I have a dead FE 340 also that didnt last long.  I had been a loyal Olympus user since getting into the SP series(Ive had 2 550's and a 570)  but two had a similar problem after a long time, but did get a lot of use out of it.  The FE series is junk.  I thought it was a fluke when the first one died. I will no longer buy Olympus.  Put your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Shipping was fast, product was bad.
Reviews.Author: Nikki
Reviews.Content: This camera is cheap. I read all the reviews and decided to give it the benefit of the doubt since it seemed to be a good camera. Now I know you get what you pay for. It has horrible resolution if you want to zoom in on any picture you take, and it takes forever for it to actually take the picture once you push the button down. If I were you reading this review, I would look elsewhere. I am disappointed with Olympus for making such a cheap camera when I feel that they are a very decent camera company.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: This camera produces blurry pictures and it takes a very long time to take a picture. I have missed many good pics because of how long the shutter time is. Don't buy!

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Fuzzy "fuzzyace"
Reviews.Content: I received the Olympus FE-4020 a week ago and am generally pleased with the little camera.  Indoor and outdoor shots are fine.Press the shutter halfway down to activate the "AF" (auto focus) - you must have a green target mark before you snap the picture.  If the target square is red/orange, your shot will be out of focus!  There are 3 options for "Focus Mode," I like "Spot."The "P" (Program Auto) shooting mode works best for me.  I don't care for the "Digital Image Stabilization" (DIS) mode.  I have not tried all the "SCN" (Scene) modes; the "Night" was neat.  And the "Magic" effects were cool.  The "Macro" and "Super Macro" produced good results of the close-up flower shots I snapped.I really like that it utilizes a rechargeable Li battery - no need to spend $ on replacing disposable batteries.  You will have to insert an SD card (purchased separately) if you want to store more than a few pictures in the minuscule internal memory (normal for most cameras of this class and higher).Practice taking shots before you photograph your important event.  And read the Instruction Manual to get the most out of the features and modes.

Reviews.Title: Rubbish
Reviews.Author: Jimmy G
Reviews.Content: The camera was bought as a gift for friend overseas. On first use there were black lines on the screen. Return & took six weeks for Olympus to repair. Returned to friend overseas . Four weeks later black lines developed on screen & grew to about one third of screen. Dont waste money on this camera - absolute rubbish

Reviews.Title: this camera is the worst
Reviews.Author: aberko
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera to go on a trip and didn't have a chance to try it out before the trip. I wish I had because I would have returned it before I left. The camera will not focus. I have sent it in to olympus to be fixed, they replaced the lens and some other parts but it still does not focus. it has a lot of fun features but it's not worth taking pictures if they are all going to be blurry. I wish I never wasted my money on this camera.

Reviews.Title: horrible camera
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for a 9 year old girl. Even though i didnt pay much for it I expected the quality to be a lot better then what it was. First of all the pink that appears on the picture is totally different then the one that we got. Its more of a purple ugly pink then that sweet pink that shows. Second of all the camera feels like a toy. i swear we have a toy camera that feels better then this. Also as soon as i took s picture with it it made this wierd sound like the camera was abouot to just die on us and not work at all. The quality of the picture is horrible. To dark and not clear enough. I'm highly dissapointed with this product and will not by olympus cameras again. I just got this item today and i'm returning it tomorrow! (if i could i would return it now!!)

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: mark
Reviews.Content: this is a great camera i bought it for my wife she loves it also she drop it in water and stop working to i sent it back the fix it for FREE

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Perkins
Reviews.Content: I needed a compact camera for slipping in my pocket and using during outdoor outings.  This Olympus camera has proven to be up to the task.  It is not a full featured digital camera, but for $76 it does much more than I expected.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY!!!
Reviews.Author: ashnicole04
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking about buying this camera, DON'T DO IT!!  I bought this camera just 3 months ago and it is already broken.  I take very good care of it and keep it in a camera case, I have barely used it, maybe 4-5 times max. The 2nd time using it, I noticed that it was delaying on turning on and having the lens extend to take pictures.  Then the last time I just tried to use it, it turns on, but the screen is completely black and it will not let me take any pictures, it also won't let me turn it off.  I thought at first maybe it just locked up so I took the battery out, by taking the battery out, it shut off but the lens was still extended.  I put the battery back in, and it turns on to show the same black screen and does the same thing.  I did this over and over to try to resolve it, nothing works.  Needless to say, this camera has been complete garbage for me. I had a Sony Digital camera for 8 years, that is still functioning, it is just the old fashioned kind that still used regular batteries so I wanted to upgrade, but big mistake on my part!

Reviews.Title: bad camera, takes blurry pictures, not worth even though cheap
Reviews.Author: pasochamp
Reviews.Content: bought this camera a year ago, but buying a new one again. I tried all possible combinations of setting but this camera takes blurry pictures 80% of the time. wasted lot of good picture opportunities. yes it has lots of features but don;t see the point if it cannot even take good pictures.

Reviews.Author: arod56
Reviews.Content: I had received this camera as a gift and was so happy with it that I purchased one for my daughter. She absolutely loves it just as I do...would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Porter
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter was thrilled with the camera.  She has had no complaints about it.  Good little camera for the low price.

Reviews.Title: So far so good...
Reviews.Author: Lizzie
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera today and I already love it! The picture quality is great and the camera itself is very good looking. It is easy to use and I hope to have it for a very long time. I highly recommend this camera to new and old camera users alike!

Reviews.Title: Horrible Camera
Reviews.Author: KTM
Reviews.Content: I picked this camera because I have had an Olympus in the past and it was great! I was very disappointed with this new camera. I am a photo major and don't like lugging my expensive camera around but now I don't have much of a choice. This camera takes horrible grainy pictures in low light with little color. I have also had a huge chunk of pixels out and I have had it for less than six months. Spring the extra money to get a canon!

Reviews.Title: Poor Image Quality
Reviews.Author: Nerko
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for $89 and I had to return It the same day.It had very poor image quality, especialy indor on low light.My 2year old Panasonic 7mb camera was much better.Face reckognition was very slow.I got new Canon SD1400 IS camera and its much better.

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD
Reviews.Author: Luciano Vasquez
Reviews.Content: ESTE ES MUY BUENO,,MUY BUENO, MUY BUENO..MUY BUENO,,MUY BUENO,MUY BUENO, MUY BUENO..MUY BUENO,,MUY BUENO,MUY BUENO, MUY BUENO..MUY BUENO,,MUY BUENO,MUY BUENO, MUY BUENO..MUY BUENO,,MUY BUENO

Reviews.Title: Bad Choice
Reviews.Author: Noria Namaz
Reviews.Content: Its a cute camera, but I have yet to register this product.  The cd program gets hung up whenever I try to register. The instructions are not clear.  I am teaching myself daily on how to use the camera. The digital cameras I owned were Cannon and were very intuitive.  I was able to take pictures and upload them almost instanty.  The co-agent in my office bought a Polaroid at the same time.  He was out taking pictures of his listings and uploading the very day it arrived, and the camera only costs $59.00 with free shipping.  I bought this camera for the built in wide-angle lens.  If I do it again, I would buy the Polaroid.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: M.R.
Reviews.Content: Wrong color item received but quick exchange for correct item...unfortunately at my own expense for return shipping.  Retailer did not offer reimbursement.

Reviews.Title: Very poor quality photos.  Blurry and grainy.
Reviews.Author: A. Kelly
Reviews.Content: Just purchased this for my daughter's birthday.  We have used many other point and shoots and this is the worst.  The pics are very grainy and blurry.  We tried many different settings and nothing helped.  I took an equivalent pic with my Canon point and shoot (2 less megapixels) and that photo was perfect.  The one taken with this Olympus was horrible.  I just printed the return info to send this back.  Maybe we just got a dud but I wasn't going to take that chance.  I think I'll just go to the store and get something else.

ProductInfo.Features:
14-megapixel resolution for high-quality, poster-size prints
4x wide-angle optical zoom
AF tracking; Intelligent Auto
Advanced Face Detection and Creative Art Filters
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Olympus FE-4020 14 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Zoom and 2.7-inch LCD (Pink)
